wms_article.title: CJ Freshway supplies 2,700 tons of local produce to cafeterias

wms_article_body.body: CJ Freshway Corp. said on Monday that it has supplied 2,700 tons of local agricultural produce to 180 school and workplace cafeterias as part of a campaign to boost sales channels for South Korean local farmers. The food company said the supply is part of a program that links farmers with consumers by working with chefs and restaurants to develop menus featuring seasonal domestic produce. Over the past year, CJ Freshway has used more than 20 types of local produce, including potatoes and onions from Seosan, South Chungcheong Province, and cabbage, radishes, and carrots from Jeju Island. “Through our collaboration between food suppliers and local governments, we aim to support local economies and serve communities,” said a company official.
